result.execSummary:
The defendant David Wade Givhan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>10-50g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense, Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)3.
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: COUNTS 16 AND 17
COUNTS 1-15

Defendant David Wade Givhan in court in custody with attorney Shanna Knueppel.  Richard J. Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Corrections made to PSI.  Parties make sentencing arguments (State's recommendation marked as Exhibit 1).  Court orders:
Counts 1-5:  6 years WSP and 6 years extended supervision, concurrent.
Counts 6-10:  4 years WSP and 2 years extended supervision, concurrent.
Count 11:  9 years WSP and 5 years extended supervision, consecutive.
Count 12:  2 years WSP and 3 years extended supervision, concurrent.
Count 13:  3 years WSP and 2 years extended supervision, concurrent.
Counts 14-15:  1 year WSP and 2 years extended supervision, concurrent.
Counts 16-17:  30 days Rock Co Jail, concurrent.
DOC to collect costs within first 2 years of extended supervision.  Defendant not eligible for prison programs; 169 days sentence credit on all counts but count 11; zero credit on count 11.  Felon warnings advised.
filed pro-se.  Filed prematurely, no action taken.

Jury finds defendant GUILTY on all counts.  Bond revoked, PSI ORDERED.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
